Description: THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE AMERICAN SAMOA POWER AUTHORITY (ASPA) IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE THROUGHOUT THE TERRITORY OF AMERICAN SAMOA. ASPA WILL PURCHASE AND USE ELECTRIC VEHICLES AND A CHARGING STATION, ELIMINATING THE USE OF FOUR LIGHT DUTY DIESEL TRUCKS, WITH THE GOAL OF REDUCING THE PUBLIC'S EXPOSURE TO HARMFUL DIESEL EXHAUST.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $118,038.  SEE TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

THESE FUNDS WILL HELP GUAM ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (GEPA) REPLACE THREE OLD DIESEL-FUELED SCHOOL BUSES WITH THE THREE NEW CLEANER DIESEL-FUELED SCHOOL BUSES MEETING EPA'S ELIGIBLE DIESEL EMISSION STANDARDS. THE THREE OLD DIESEL SCHOOL BUSES OF A SIMILAR ENGINE SIZE, WHICH ARE CURRENTLY OPERATING, WILL BE PROPERLY SCRAPPED AND RENDERED INOPERABLE UNDER PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $78,849.  SEE TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE NEVADA DIVISION OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION (NDEP) IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF NEVADA. NDEP WILL REPLACE TEN PROGRAM-ELIGIBLE DIESEL-POWERED SCHOOL BUSES AND FIVE PROGRAM-ELIGIBLE DIESEL-POWERED MUNICIPAL SERVICE VEHICLES WITH CLEANER VEHICLES. THIS PROJECT WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $477,788.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE CALIFORNIA AIR RESOURCES BOARD (CARB) IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA.  CARB WILL REPLACE DIESEL-FUELED SCHOOL BUSES WITH ZERO-EMISSION ELECTRIC SCHOOL AND/OR OTHER TYPES OF ON-ROAD HEAVY-DUTY DIESEL VEHICLES WITH ZERO-EMISSION VEHICLES, WHICH WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $556,361.

THIS PROJECT WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES. ADDITIONALLY, THEY WILL REPLACE TWO DIESEL BUSES WITH TWO BATTERY-ELECTRIC BUSES. THIS ASSISTANCE AMENDMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $474,741.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL SUPPORT THE MARICOPA AIR QUALITY DEPARMENT IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF ARIZONA. THE PROJECT IS TO REPLACE 22 VEHICLES WITH CLEANER BURNING ENGINES, THEREBY REDUCING EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $486,183.  PRE-AWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 10/01/2019.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE AMERICAN SAMOA POWER AUTHORITY (ASPA), IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE THROUGHOUT AMERICAN SAMOA. THE MANU'A ISLANDS CONSISTING OF THE OFU AND TAU ISLANDS HAVE BEEN CONVERTED TO RENEWABLE ENERGY SYSTEMS FROM A DIESEL GENERATED SYSTEM. THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS FOR THE AMERICAN SAMOA TO START IMPLEMENTING A PILOT PHASE OF CONVERTING LAND BASED VEHICLES TO BATTERY-POWERED ELECTTIC VEHICLES (EV). ASPA WILL REPLACE FOUR LIGHT DUTY DIESEL TRUCKS WITH FOUR EV UTILITY TRUCKS. ALSO INCLUDED IN THIS PROJECT IS THE INSTALLATION OF THREE LEVEL 2 ELECTRIC VEHICLE CHARGING STATIONS. THIS ELIMINATION OF DIESEL ENGINES, WITH EV REPLACEMENTS, WILL REDUCE DIESEL FUEL USE, EMISSIONS AND ASSOCIATED DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS BY 100%. THE FOUR DIESEL VEHICLES WILL BE SCRAPPED UPON THE OPERATIONAL USE OF THE NEW EVS.  ASPA HAS SET GOALS TO HAVE 50% OF ITS

THE GUAM ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY WILL PROVIDE A SUBAWARD TO THE GUAM DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC WORKS (DPW) TO REPLACE THREE BUSES IN THE CURRENT SCHOOL BUS FLEET.  THE THREE OLD DIESEL-FUELED SCHOOL BUSES WILL BE PROPERLY REPLACED WITH THREE NEW, CLEANER SCHOOL BUSES MEETING EPA'S ELIGIBLE DIESEL EMISSION STANDARDS. THE THREE OLD DIESEL SCHOOL BUSES OF A SIMILAR ENGINE SIZE, WHICH ARE CURRENTLY OPERATING, WILL BE PROPERLY SCRAPPED AND RENDERED INOPERABLE UNDER THE DERA PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS. THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE AMERICAN SAMOA POWER AUTHORITY (ASPA) IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE THROUGHOUT THE TERRITORY OF AMERICAN SAMOA. ASPA WILL USE DIESEL EMISSIONS REDUCTION ACT (DERA) FUNDS TO REPLACE AN OLDER WORK VEHICLE WEIGHT RATING (GVWR) 33,000 POUNDS WITH A 2021 MODEL YEAR DIESEL ENGINE VACUUM TRUCK. WITH THE EPA GOALS OF REDUCING ROAD VEHICLE EMISSION BY CONVERTING TO CLEANER, LOWER EMISSION VEHICLES, ASPA IS GRADUALLY REPLACING ITS OLDER INEFFICIENT DIESEL TRUCKS WITH LOWER EMISSION AND HIGHER FUEL EFFICIENCY TRUCKS.

THE COMMONWEALTH OF THE NORTHERN MARIANAS ISLANDS' (CNMI) BUREAU OF ENVIRONMENTAL AND COASTAL QUALITY (BECQ) WILL PROVIDE A SUBAWARD TO DEPARTMENT OF LAND AND NATURAL RESOURCES' (DLNR) DIVISION OF AGRICULTURE TO REPLACE ONE CURRENTLY OPERATING DIESEL FUELED AGRICULTURAL TRACTOR TIER 1 WITH A TIER 4 ENGINE OR NEWER DIESEL FUELED TRACTOR THAT WILL PERFORM SIMILAR FUNCTIONS. IT IS EXPECTED THIS PROJECT WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NOX, PM2.5, HC, CO AND CO2 [NITROGEN OXIDES (NOX), PARTICULATE MATTER (PM2.5), HYDROCARBONS (HC), CARBON MONOXIDE (CO), AND CARBON DIOXIDE (CO2)].   THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $81,441.

DESCRIPTION:THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT (KDHE) WILL CONTINUE IMPLEMENTING THE KANSAS CLEAN DIESEL PROGRAM. PAST DERA AND ARRA ACTIVITIES DATE BACK TO 2008 USING BOTH THE COMPETITIVE AND STATE ALLOCATION FUNDING SOURCES. P IN 2017 KDHE WAS NAMED THE LEAD AGENCY FOR VW MITIGATION TRUST ACTIVITIES IN KANSAS. KDHE WAS UNABLE TO PARTICIPATE IN THE 2021 OFFERING DUE TO STAFFING CONCERNS BUT THE 2022 IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT STAFFING WILL NOT BE A CONCERN.  THE REQUIRED TRUST SPENDING OVERVIEW INCLUDED USING TRUST FUNDS TO MATCH DERA FUNDS FOR PROGRAM EXPANSION. ACTIVITIES:PROJECTS FUNDED INCLUDE LOCOMOTIVE REPOWERS, IDLING REDUCTION TECHNOLOGIES FOR LONG HAUL CLASS - 8 VEHICLES, PARTICULATE POLLUTION REDUCTION TECHNOLOGIES, NONROAD ENGINE REPLACEMENTS, AND EARLY SCHOOL BUS REPLACEMENTS. THE PROGRAM WAS REBOOTED IN 2016 WITH A FOCUS ON EARLY SCHOOL BUS REPLACEMENTS.

THE PROGRAM WILL USE THE ALLOCATED FUNDING TO OFFER PARTIAL REIMBURSEMENT FOR THE PURCHASE OF NEW SCHOOL BUSES TO REPLACE BUSES THAT WILL BE RETIRED AND DECOMMISSIONED AHEAD OF THE NORMAL ATTRITION SCHEDULES. THE PROJECTS WILL BE SELECTED USING A RANDOM NUMBER DRAWING AFTER THE ENTITIES AND VEHICLES ARE VERIFIED AS ELIGIBLE BY KDHE STAFFSUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:KSDE EXPECTS TO MAINTAIN AN EXPANDED DERA PROGRAM DOCUMENT TO PROMOTE PROGRAM TO PARTNERS, UPDATE WEBSITE, WRITE 15-25 AGREEMENTS, PURCHASE 25 BUSES, DECOMMISSION 25 BUSES.  HEALTH OUTCOMES: EXPECTS REDUCED HEALTHCARE COSTS DUE TO PM WYANDOTTE COUNTY: $110,000, SALINE COUNTY: $21,00, WALLACE COUNTY: $5,400.

PURPOSE: PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING TO MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES FOR IMPLEMENTATION OF A STATE DIESEL EMISSION REDUCTION ACT PROGRAM.

EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS IN THE AFFECTED COMMUNITIES.  
INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE THE FUNDING RECIPIENTS AS WELL AS MISSOURI RESIDENTS IN LOCAL COMMUNITIES.  
SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NOT ANY SUBRECIPIENTS UNDER THE PROGRAM

PRIORITY WILL BE GIVEN TO VEHICLES/EQUIPMENT THAT OPERATE IN THE LOGAN, PROVO, AND SALT LAKE, UT, PM2.5 NON-ATTAINMENT AREAS AND THE NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN WASATCH FRONT OZONE NONATTAINMENT AREAS. THESE REPLACEMENTS WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.

THIS PROJECT TO REPLACE HIGHWAY VEHICLES WITH NEWER, CLEANER VEHICLES WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.

COLORADO'S CLEAN DIESEL PROGRAM WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO REPLACE OLDER DIESEL OIL AND GAS DRILL RIG ENGINES IN COLORADO WITH CLEANER DUEL-FUEL (DIESEL AND LIQUID NATURAL GAS (LNG)), NATURAL GAS, OR LNG ONLY ENGINES. THE USE OF NATURAL GAS OR LNG TO POWER (OR PARTIALLY POWER) THESE DRILL RIGS WILL REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF DIESEL EMISSIONS THAT WOULD OTHERWISE BE PRODUCED. THESE REPLACEMENTS WILL PROTECT DRILL RIG PERSONNEL, MANY OF WHOM WORK FULL TIME ON OR NEAR THE DRILL RIGS FROM DIRECT EXPOSURES TO TOXIC DIESEL EXHAUST. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO PROTECT NEIGHBORING COMMUNITIES AND THE ENVIRONMENT.

THE UTAH DIVISION OF AIR QUALITY (UDAQ) PROPOSES TO USE FY 2017 STATE CLEAN DIESEL PROGRAM FUNDS FOR SCHOOL BUS REPLACEMENT REBATES WITH PRIORITY GIVEN TO BUSES THAT OPERATE IN PM2.5 NON-ATTAINMENT AREAS.

THE WYOMING DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY WILL DEVELOP A PROGRAM TO RETROFIT DIESEL SCHOOL BUSES AND REPLACE DIESEL POWERED SCHOOL BUSES.  WITH THE FY17 FUNDS, THE STATE ESTIMATES RETROFITTING 145 DIESEL SCHOOL BUSES WITH EMISSION CONTROL DEVICES AND REPLACING UP TO 8 SCHOOL BUSES.  IN ADDITION, IDLE REDUCTION DEVICES MAY ALSO BE INSTALLED DEPENDANT UPON INTEREST OF PARTICIPATING SCHOOL DISTRICTS. THIS RETROFIT PROJECT WILL REDUCE EXPOSURE TO THE PUBLIC TO EMITTED POLLUTANTS, PROVIDING HEALTH BENEFITS TO THOSE WITH ASTHMA AND OTHER RESPIRATORY CHALLENGES AND IMPROVING AIR QUALITY IN GENERAL.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO THE OKLAHOMA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (ODEQ), TO IMPLEMENT ITS OWN PROJECT TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS. OKLAHOMA PROPOSES TO FOCUS ON THE REPLACEMENT OF SCHOOL BUSES. WITH THE ESTIMATED BUDGET, ODEQ ANTICIPATES REPLACING 32 BUSES WITH FY22 FUNDING; THIS IS IN ADDITION TO THE 25 BUSES THAT WE EXPECT TO BE FUNDED WITH FY21 FUNDING. THE SCHOOL BUSES TO BE REPLACED IN THIS APPLICATION OPERATE THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA. THIS WILL RESULT IN A REDUCTION IN POLLUTANTS EMITTED FROM DIESEL ENGINES, IMPROVED AIR QUALITY, AND REDUCED EXPOSURE TO HARMFUL DIESEL EXHAUST. DIESEL EMISSIONS ARE AN IMPORTANT AIR QUALITY CONCERN AND HAVE PUBLIC HEALTH IMPLICATIONS. THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE PUBLIC AND IN PARTICULAR, THOSE WHO LIVE, WORK OR PLAY NEAR WHERE THE AFFECTED FLEET OPERATES. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE THE RESIDENTS IN THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA. THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT SHOULD BENEFIT THE PUBLIC WITH CLEANER AIR AND LOWER TOXIC EMISSIONS OF DIESEL EXHAUST. 

FOR FY22, ELIGIBLE DIESEL BUSES TO BE REPLACED MUST MEET ALL THE FOLLOWING: 
- MUST BE USED TO CARRY STUDENTS TO AND FROM SCHOOL OR RELATED EVENTS ON A REGULAR BASIS. 
- MUST BE IDENTIFIED WITH THE WORDS 'SCHOOL BUS' AND BE PAINTED NATIONAL SCHOOL BUS GLOSSY YELLOW. 
- MUST BE DIESEL FUELED. - MUST BE FULLY OPERATIONAL. 
- MUST BE OWNED AND OPERATED BY PARTICIPATING FLEET OWNER FOR THE TWO YEARS PRIOR TO UPGRADE. 
- MUST HAVE AT LEAST THREE YEARS OF REMAINING LIFE AT THE TIME OF UPGRADE. 
- MUST HAVE ACCUMULATED AT LEAST 7,000 MILES/YEAR DURING THE TWO YEARS PRIOR TO UPGRADE, OR DURING CALENDAR YEAR (JAN-DEC) 2019. 
- MUST HAVE AN ENGINE MODEL YEAR (EMY) 2009 OR OLDER, IF BEING REPLACED WITH A BUS THAT HAS AN ENGINE CERTIFIED TO MEET ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION A EMISSIONS STANDARDS. 
- MUST BE SCHOOL BUS TYPE A, B, C, OR D. FOR FY21, ELIGIBLE REPLACEMENT PROJECTS MUST INCLUDE ALL OF THE FOLLOWING: 
- A SCHOOL BUS OR BUSES OPERATING ON ONE OF THE FOLLOWING FUEL TYPES: DIESEL, GASOLINE, ALL ELECTRIC, PROPANE LIQUEFIED PETROLEUM GAS (LPG), OR LIQUEFIED NATURAL GAS (LNG) OR COMPRESSED NATURAL GAS (CNG). 
- A REPLACEMENT SCHOOL BUS OR BUSES WITH EMY 2019 OR NEWER. 
- A BUS OR BUSES WITH GROSS VEHICLE WEIGHT RATING (GVWR) CLASS 4-8 OF THE SAME OR SIMILAR TYPE OF GVWR THAN THE ELIGIBLE BUS. THE REPLACEMENT VEHICLE MUST NOT BE A LARGER WEIGHT CLASS THAN THE EXISTING VEHICLE. 
- A BUS OR BUSES WHICH OPERATES PRIMARILY WITHIN THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA.

FOR FY22, ELIGIBLE REPLACEMENT PROJECTS MUST INCLUDE ALL OF THE FOLLOWING: - A NEW SCHOOL BUS OR BUSES OPERATING ON DIESEL OR GASOLINE FUEL. 
- A NEW REPLACEMENT SCHOOL BUS OR BUSES WITH EMY 2019 OR NEWER. 
- BUS OR BUSES WITH A TYPE A, B, C, OR D THAT IS THE SAME TYPE AS THE ELIGIBLE BUS TO BE REPLACED. 
- THE NEW REPLACEMENT VEHICLE MUST NOT BE OF A LARGER CLASS OF GROSS VEHICLE WEIGHT RATING (GVWR) THAN THE EXISTING VEHICLE. O CLASS 5: 16,001 - 19,500 LBS GVWR O CLASS 6: 19,501 - 26,000 LBS GVWR O CLASS 7: 26,001 - 33,000 LBS GVWR O CLASS 8: 33,001 LBS GVWR AND OVER 
- THE NEW BUS OR BUSES MUST MEET EPA'S HEAVY-DUTY HIGHWAY ENGINE EMISSION STANDARDS. FOR FY21, REIMBURSEMENT AMOUNTS ARE: 
- OKLAHOMA MAY FUND UP TO 25% OF THE COST OF A REPLACEMENT VEHICLE POWERED BY A 2019 MODEL YEAR OR NEWER ENGINE CERTIFIED TO EPA EMISSION STANDARDS. HIGHWAY ENGINE EMISSION STANDARDS ARE AVAILABLE AT: HTTPS://WWW.EPA.GOV/EMISSION-STANDARDS-REFERENCEGUIDE/EPA-EMISSION-STANDARDS-HEAVY-DUTY-HIGHWAY-ENGINES-AND-VEHICLES.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $520,082 TO SUPPORT THE ALABAMA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF ALABAMA. THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $345,754 TO THE KENTUCKY ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT CABINET TO ASSIST IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS BY USING STATE GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS AS A REIMBURSEMENT PROGRAM FOR DIESEL SCHOOL BUS REPLACEMENTS. THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE PUBLIC AND IN PARTICULAR, THOSE WHO LIVE, WORK OR PLAY NEAR WHERE THE AFFECTED FLEET OPERATES WITH CLEANER AIR AND LOWER TOXIC EMISSIONS OF DIESEL EXHAUST.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $514,113 TO MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY. DISTRICTS IN MISSISSIPPI WILL BE GIVEN AN OPPORTUNITY TO APPLY FOR ASSISTANCE IN REPLACING MODEL YEAR 2009 AND OLDER SCHOOL BUSES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARY IS THE STATE OF MISSISSIPPI. THIS WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF THE DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDE, PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5, CARBON MONOXIDE, CARBON DIOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $536,246 TO GEORGIA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS DIESEL EMISSIONS REDUCTION ACT FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDS TO THE GEORGIA ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION DIVISION TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF GEORGIA. THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION DIVISION WILL ACHIEVE THESE DELIVERABLES BY DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF GEORGIA. THE NUMBER OF BUSES REPLACED WILL DEPEND ON THE TECHNOLOGY CHOSEN BY THE SCHOOL DISTRICTS, BUT THE EXPECTATION IS THAT 32 SCHOOL BUSES WILL BE REPLACED. THE SPECIFIC OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT ARE EXPECTED TO HELP IMPROVE REGIONAL, LOCAL, AND VEHICLE CABIN AIR QUALITY THROUGH THE EARLY REPLACEMENT OF SCHOOL BUSES. THE PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO YIELD 2.21 SHORT TONS PER YEAR OF NITROGEN OXIDES (NOX) EMISSIONS REDUCED, 0.163 SHORT TONS PER YEAR OF PARTICULAR MATTER WITH DIAMETERS LESS 2.5 MICROMETERS EMISSIONS REDUCED, 0.13 SHORT TONS PER YEAR OF CARBON MONOXIDE EMISSIONS REDUCED, AND 0.224 SHORT TONS PER YEAR OF HYDROCARBON EMISSIONS REDUCED FOR THE PROJECT&RSQUOANDS LIFETIME. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF STATE OF GEORGIA, THAT WILL BENEFIT FROM THE GRANT.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $350,160 TO THE TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND CONSERVATION. THE PURPOSE OF THIS DIESEL EMISSIONS REDUCTION ACT FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDS TO TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND CONSERVATION TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF TENNESSEE.  EAST TENNESSEE CLEAN FUELS COALITION (ETCF) WILL ACHIEVE THESE DELIVERABLES BY DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE THROUGH THE STATE OF TENNESSEE. THIS PROJECT WILL FUND THE REPLACEMENT OF ELIGIBLE DIESEL MEDIUM- AND HEAVY-DUTY VEHICLES WITH NEW, CLEANER VEHICLES. PROPANE, COMPRESSED NATURAL GAS, ELECTRIC, AND NEW DIESEL VEHICLES WILL BE ELIGIBLE AS REPLACEMENTS WITH A PRIORITIZATION FOR THE ADOPTION OF ALTERNATIVE FUELS TO OCCUR DURING APPLICATION EVALUATION. THE SPECIFIC OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT ARE EXPECTED TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS FROM OLDER, MORE POLLUTING DIESEL VEHICLES IN TENNESSEE COMMUNITIES IS AN IMPORTANT STEP TOWARDS PROTECTING PUBLIC HEALTH AND CAN PROVIDE A RANGE OF BENEFITS, INCLUDING REDUCING HEALTH CARE COSTS AND CONTINUING TENNESSEE&RSQUOANDS OVERALL AIR QUALITY IMPROVEMENTS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE THE MORE SENSITIVE CLASSES OF THE POPULATION, LIKE YOUNGER AND OLDER CITIZENS WHO MAY BE MORE VULNERABLE TO THE HEALTH IMPACTS OF SEVERAL CRITERIA POLLUTANTS.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $566,261 TO THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION TO SUPPORT THEIR EFFORT WITH IMPROVING AIR QUALITY IN FLORIDA BY REDUCING EMISSIONS OF DIESEL ENGINES AND REDUCING DIESEL EMISSIONS EXPOSURE. FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION WILL FUND LARGE-SCALE PROJECTS, SUCH AS MARINE VESSEL REPOWERING OR REPLACEMENTS TO REDUCE AIR POLLUTION FROM CRITERIA POLLUTANTS AND AIR TOXICS. THE PROJECT TYPES TO BE FUNDED DURING THE 2021 BUDGET CYCLE WILL FOCUS ON PORTS AND OTHER MODES OF COMMERCE, PRIMARILY THROUGH MARINE ENGINES AND OTHER ON-ROAD, NONROAD, OR RAIL OPTIONS. THE OUTCOME IS EXPECTED TO REDUCE LOCAL AND REGIONAL AIR POLLUTION FROM CRITERIA POLLUTANTS AND AIR TOXICS. THE DEPARTMENT WILL UTILIZE THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY&RSQUOANDS DIESEL EMISSIONS QUANTIFIER, AMONG OTHER TOOLS, TO QUANTIFY THE EMISSION REDUCTIONS FOR EACH PROJECT. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF FLORIDA.

THIS ACTION APPROVES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $346,382 TO SOUTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF SOUTH CAROLINA. THESE PROJECTS WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NOX AND HYDROCARBONS. THE PROJECT WILL HELP ACHIEVE AIR QUALITY WHICH WILL BENEFIT THE CITIZENS OF SOUTH CAROLINA.

THE MISSION OF THE NEW MEXICO ENVIRONMENT DEPARTMENT'S AIR QUALITY BUREAU (AQB) IS TO 'PROTECT THE INHABITANTS AND NATURAL BEAUTY OF NEW MEXICO BY PREVENTING THE DETERIORATION OF AIR QUALITY.' REDUCING HARMFUL EMISSIONS GENERATED FROM HEAVY-DUTY DIESEL-FUELED VEHICLES IS A PROGRESSIVE STEP TOWARDS UPHOLDING THE MISSION OF THE AQB. 
DERA FUNDS AFFORD THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO THE OPPORTUNITY TO ADDRESS AND REDUCE HARMFUL EMISSIONS GENERATED BY HEAVY-DUTY DIESEL-FUELED TRUCKS. THE AQB HAS SUCCESSFULLY IMPLEMENTED A VARIETY OF DIESEL EMISSION REDUCTION PROJECTS THROUGHOUT THE STATE, ENHANCING AIR QUALITY AND THE QUALITY OF THE LIVES OF THE RESIDENTS THAT ARE REGULARLY EXPOSED TO THE HARMFUL EMISSIONS EMITTED FROM DIESEL-FUELED VEHICLES.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (WDNR) IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF WISCONSIN. WDNR WILL TARGET PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SCHOOL AND MUNICIPAL TRANSIT BUS FLEETS FOR PROJECTS LOOKING TO REPLACE OLDER BUSES WITH NEW DIESEL OR ALTERNATIVE FUELED BUSES MEETING MORE STRINGENT EMISSION STANDARDS. WDNRS PROGRAM WILL ALSO TARGET QUALIFYING NON-ROAD DIESEL ENGINES FOR REPLACEMENT AND RETROFIT. THE PROJECTS UNDER WDNRS PROGRAM WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS. THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE PUBLIC AND IN PARTICULAR, THOSE WHO LIVE, WORK OR PLAY NEAR WHERE THE AFFECTED FLEET OPERATES. THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT SHOULD BENEFIT THE PUBLIC WITH CLEANER AIR AND LOWER TOXIC EMISSIONS OF DIESEL EXHAUST.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (IDEM) IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE IN THE STATE OF INDIANA. IDEM INTENDS TO FOCUS THE USE OF THESE FUNDS IN FOUR KEY AREAS: RAIL-ORIENTED REDUCTIONS, MARINE-ORIENTED REDUCTIONS, ONROAD VEHICLE APPLICATIONS AND NONROAD VEHICLE IMPROVEMENTS. IDEM WILL USE A VARIETY OF TECHNOLOGY OPTIONS AS A PART OF THIS PROGRAM WHICH WILL LIKELY INCLUDE, BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO, THE AFOREMENTIONED DIESEL OXIDATION CATALYSTS, DIESEL PARTICULATE FILTERS, CLOSED CRANKCASE FILTRATION SYSTEMS, IDLE REDUCTION TECHNOLOGIES, VEHICLE AND ENGINE REPLACEMENTS AND REPOWERS AS WELL AS TECHNOLOGIES TO IMPROVE FUEL EFFICIENCY OF VARIOUS DIESEL POWERED EQUIPMENT. THESE TECHNOLOGIES AND STRATEGIES WILL BE EMPLOYED ON ONROAD, NONROAD, AND MARINE DIESEL ENGINES WHERE APPROPRIATE AND WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS HC, CO, CO2, NOX, AND PM. THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE PUBLIC AND IN PARTICULAR, THOSE WHO LIVE, WORK OR PLAY NEAR WHERE THE AFFECTED FLEET OPERATES. THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT SHOULD BENEFIT THE PUBLIC WITH CLEANER AIR AND LOWER TOXIC EMISSIONS OF DIESEL EXHAUST.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (IDEM) IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF INDIANA. PROJECTS IMPLEMENTED THROUGH THIS AGREEMENT WILL INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO, DIESEL OXIDATION CATALYSTS, DIESEL PARTICULATE FILTERS, CLOSED CRANKCASE FILTRATION SYSTEMS, IDLE REDUCTION TECHNOLOGIES, VEHICLE AND ENGINE REPLACEMENTS AND REPOWERS, AS WELL AS TECHNOLOGIES TO IMPROVE THE FUEL EFFICIENCY OF VARIOUS DIESEL-POWERED EQUIPMENT. IDEM WILL FOCUS ON FOUR KEY AREAS: RAIL-ORIENTED REDUCTIONS, MARINE-ORIENTED REDUCTIONS, ONROAD VEHICLE APPLICATIONS, AND NONROAD VEHICLE IMPROVEMENTS. THESE PROJECTS WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.

THE INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (IDEM) WILL FOCUS CLEAN DIESEL EFFORTS IN FOUR KEY AREAS; RAIL, MARINE, ON-ROAD AND NON-ROAD VEHICLE APPLICATIONS. IDEM WILL ENSURE THAT A VARIETY OF TECHNOLOGY OPTIONS ARE UTILIZED AS A PART OF THIS PROGRAM. IDEM WILL USE THE ESTABLISHED STATE PROGRAM TO IMPLEMENT PROJECTS THAT ACHIEVE SIGNIFICANT DIESEL EMISSIONS REDUCTIONS, PARTICULARLY FROM FLEETS OPERATING IN AREAS DESIGNATED AS AIR QUALITY NONATTAINMENT OR MAINTENANCE AREAS.

RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (RI D.E.M.) ANTICIPATES THE REPLACEMENT AND/OR RETROFIT OF IDENTIFIED PRIORITY FLEETS OF VEHICLES USED BY ALL ENTITIES (PRIVATE AND PUBLIC) THAT OWN AND OPERATE FLEETS WITHIN THE STATE. THESE WILL INCLUDE ON-ROAD HIGHWAY HEAVY DUTY VEHICLES, EMERGENCY VEHICLES, UTILITY, CONSTRUCTION/REFUSE EQUIPMENT/VEHICLES, MARINE ENGINES, AND/OR NONROAD ENGINES, EQUIPMENT OR VEHICLES. RI D.E.M. IDENTIFIES PRIORITY FLEETS OF VEHICLES, BASED ON CRITERIA TO MAXIMIZE PUBLIC HEALTH BENEFITS, BE COST EFFECTIVE AND TARGET AREAS WITH HIGH POPULATION DENSITY, THAT ARE POOR AIR QUALITY AREAS (INCLUDING NONATTAINMENT OR MAINTENANCE OF NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS FOR A CRITERIA POLLUTANT; OR AREAS WITH TOXIC AIR POLLUTANT CONCERNS) OR RECEIVE A DISPROPORTIONATE QUANTITY OF AIR POLLUTION FROM DIESEL FLEETS INCLUDING PORTS, RAIL YARDS, TERMINALS, CONSTRUCTION SITES, DEPOTS, OR CORRIDORS.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE MASSACHUSETTS DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF MASSACHUSETTS. VEHICLES, ENGINES, AND/OR EQUIPMENT TARGETED FOR EMISSION REDUCTIONS COULD BE OWNED BY PROJECT PARTNERS SUCH AS MUNICIPALITIES, PUBLIC SCHOOLS, AND OTHER STATE AGENCIES, AS WELL AS BY PRIVATE SECTOR ENTITIES. FUNDS COULD BE USED FOR EARLY REPLACEMENT, REPOWER OR RETROFITS OF AGRICULTURAL EQUIPMENT IN THE STATEAND REPLACEMENT OR REPOWER OF MEDIUM AND HEAVY-DUTY DIESEL TRUCKSAND REPLACEMENT OR REPOWER OF CONSTRUCTION EQUIPMENTAND PORT EQUIPMENT, SHORE-POWER OR A MARINE ENGINE DIESEL PROJECT AT MASSACHUSETTS PORTSAND IDLE REDUCTION TECHNOLOGIES, INCLUDING AUXILIARY POWER UNITS (APUS)AND RETROFIT TECHNOLOGIES FOR DIESEL VEHICLES OR NON-ROAD EQUIPMENTAND REPLACEMENT OR REPOWERING OF TRANSPORT REFRIGERATION UNITS (TRUS)AND OR OTHER DIESEL PROJECTS CONSISTENT WITH AGENCY NEEDS AND REQUIREMENTS. THESE TECHNOLOGIES AND EQUIPMENT WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANT SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.

CT INTENDS TO FUND GRANTS OR REBATES TO MUNICIPALITIES AND STATE AGENCIES FOR THE REPLACEMENT, REPOWERING OR RETROFITTING OF DIESEL VEHICLES OR EQUIPMENT IN THEIR FLEETS, WITH AN EMPHASIS ON EQUIPMENT THAT MIGHT NOT BE ELIGIBLE FOR VOLKSWAGEN MITIGATION TRUST FUNDING. IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT MOST OF THE CONNECTICUT&RSQUOANDS FY 2021 STATE DERA FUNDS WILL BE PASSED THROUGH TO MUNICIPALITIES, OTHER STATE AGENCIES AND/OR PRIVATE ENTITIES AS REIMBURSEMENTS FOR COMPLETED PROJECTS. CLEAN DIESEL PROJECT GRANTS MAY ALSO INCLUDE SUBAWARDS. SOME AWARDEES MAY INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO, PRIVATE ENTITIES SUCH AS RAILROADS, DISTRIBUTION CENTER OPERATORS OR REFUSE HAULERS. TECHNOLOGIES WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE NEW HAMPSHIRE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF NEW HAMPSHIRE. NH WILL INSTITUTE A SUB-GRANT PROGRAM TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR REPLACEMENT OR REPOWERING OF DIESEL VEHICLES AND ELIGIBLE EQUIPMENT IN THEIR FLEETS. PRIORITY WILL BE GIVEN TO HEAVY-DUTY HIGHWAY VEHICLES AND CONSTRUCTION EQUIPMENT. REPLACEMENTS COULD INCLUDE ELECTRIC, HYBRID ELECTRIC, CNG OR PROPANE POWERED VEHICLES AS WELL AS CLEANER DIESEL VEHICLES OR EQUIPMENT. NH WILL ALSO CONTINUE TO SUPPORT LOCOMOTIVE AND PORT-RELATED PROJECTS SUCH AS REPLACEMENT, REPOWER OR RETROFIT OF DRAYAGE TRUCKS OR PORT EQUIPMENT, INSTALLING IDLE REDUCTION TECHNOLOGY ON LOCOMOTIVE ENGINES, UPGRADING OR REPLACING MARINE ENGINES AND VESSELS OR ESTABLISHING SHORE POWER FACILITIES. TECHNOLOGIES WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE VERMONT DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION (VTDEC) IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF VERMONT. VTDEC WILL INITIATE WORK UNDER THIS PROGRAM WITH A SERIES OF OPEN SOLICITATIONS TO LOCAL, STATE, AND REGIONAL AGENCIES OR DEPARTMENTS, AS WELL AS BUSINESSES OPERATING PRIMARILY IN VERMONT. ALL PROJECTS WILL REDUCE EMISSIONS OF DIESEL PARTICULATE MATTER AND OTHER POLLUTANTS SUCH AS NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE AND HYDROCARBONS.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT IN ITS EFFORTS TO REDUCE DIESEL EMISSIONS AND EXPOSURE THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF RHODE ISLAND.  DERA FUNDING WILL FOCUS ON REDUCING DIESEL EMISSIONS FROM NUMEROUS SOURCES FROM BOTH PRIVATE AND PUBLIC FLEETS. PROJECT PROPOSALS THAT INCLUDE PRIORITY FLEETS OF ON-ROAD HEAVY DUTY VEHICLES AND MARINE ENGINES WILL BE GIVEN PRIORITY.THE WORK PLAN ANTICIPATES THE REPLACEMENT AND/OR RETROFIT AND IDLE REDUCTION SOLUTIONS OF IDENTIFIED PRIORITY FLEETS OF VEHICLES USED BY ALL ENTITIES (PRIVATE AND PUBLIC) THAT OWN AND OPERATE FLEETS WITHIN THE STATE OF RHODE ISLAND. THESE WILL INCLUDE ON-ROAD HIGHWAY HEAVY DUTY VEHICLES, EMERGENCY VEHICLES, UTILITY, CONSTRUCTION/REFUSE EQUIPMENT/VEHICLES, MARINE ENGINES, AND/OR NONROAD ENGINES, EQUIPMENT OR VEHICLES.
